question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
Let

\[\displaystyle f : A \to B\] be a function and let

\[C \subseteq A\] and $D \subseteq B$. Define the sets

\[\displaystyle f^{-1} (D)\] and $\displaystyle f (C)$.
sols:
\[f^{-1}(D) = \{ a \in A \mid f(a) \in D \}\]

and

\[f(C) = \{ f(c)\mid c\in C \}.\]
hints:
Recall that

\[\displaystyle f^{-1}(D)\]

is the pre-image of the set $D$, that is the set containing all the
elements that are mapped by $f$ into the set $D$ and that

\[\displaystyle f(C)\]

is the image of the set $C$, that is the set all the images of elements
of the set $C$.
